title: Why is country music depressing? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Country music is hypothesized to nurture a suicidal mood through its concerns with problems common in the suicidal population, such as marital discord, alcohol abuse, and alienation from work. The results of a multiple regression analysis of 49 metropolitan areas show that the greater the airtime devoted to country music, the greater the white suicide rate. The effect is independent of divorce, southernness, poverty, and gun availability. The existence of a country music subculture is thought to reinforce the link between country music and suicide. Our model explains 51% of the variance in urban white suicide rates.” To be fair, Some newer country music seems to have a different theme in words. Interestingly, there is some evidence that a song or two a couple of times a week would have the opposite effect. Contrast. For some of us, the contrast of listening to a genre we enjoy more, might also be uplifting.

I think there is a stereotype surrounding country music, labeling it as being depressive, some people even link it to suicide. But in truth, there is no evidence that these music genres are sadder than others. Also, the music itself does not cause depression; however, it can make you experience a depressed mood. this is related to your personal experience, level of empathy and the mood you were before starting to listen to a particular song. Understanding what makes music sad: ModesModes involve the arrangement and ordering of musical notes in a particular key. It’s this arrangement of notes that create the chords we hear, which lend themselves to our perception of a piece’s tonality. TempoTempo refers to the speed, or pace, of a musical piece, with fast music portraying happiness and slow music portraying sadness. Interactions Between Musical CharacteristicsEmotional expression is really more about the interactions between how different musical characteristics are structured. The same song can be sung by different performers and achieve different emotional results. Perceived musical emotions also depend on the listener. One listener may be touched by a particular song, whereas others might not be.  If you found this answer helpful, please leave an upvote.
